com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.action

Class ActionResultBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.action.ActionResultBuilder

  • public final class ActionResultBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Build an ActionResult. We use a builder pattern here because there are a number of optional values that can be set as part of returning a result.

    Here is an example of how to use the ActionResultBuilder: 

     return new ActionResultBuilder().
   setPreventOrProtectStatus(PreventOrProtectStatus.CONTENT_REMOVED).
   setMessage("The document containing the policy violation was removed").
   getResult();

    For recommended best practices about communicating status information from a FlexResponse plugin action, please see the FlexResponse SDK documentation.

      Constructors

      ActionResultBuilder()
      Construct a default builder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionResultBuilder

        public ActionResultBuilder()
        Construct a default builder. The default values of the result are as follows:

        messageEmpty string
        actionSuccessfultrue
        preventOrProtectStatusNone - the prevent/protect status is unchanged
        remediationLocationNone - the remediation location will not be set

    • Method Detail

      • setMessage

        public ActionResultBuilder setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Set the message for the result.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to display in the incident history for the entry describing the result of the action.
        Returns:
        the ActionResultBuilder with the message set.

      • setActionSuccessful

        public ActionResultBuilder setActionSuccessful(boolean actionSuccessful)
        Indicate whether the action was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        actionSuccessful - indicates the success or failure of the action.
        Returns:
        the ActionResultBuilder with the action status set.

      • setRemediationLocation

        public ActionResultBuilder setRemediationLocation(java.lang.String remediationLocation)
        Specify the remediation location for the item causing the incident. For example, if the action quarantines a file, this should specify the path to where the file was quarantined.
        Parameters:
        remediationLocation - identifies where the incident item was remediated.
        Returns:
        the ActionResultBuilder with the remediation location set.

      • setPreventOrProtectStatus

        public ActionResultBuilder setPreventOrProtectStatus(PreventOrProtectStatus preventOrProtectStatus)
        Set the prevent/protect status for this incident.

        Thought needs to be given before setting this status. For example, if you are unquarantining a file, and this action fails, you might not want to set the prevent/protect status to FLEX_RESPONSE_ERROR, as this erases the previous status of PROTECT_FILE_QUARANTINED

        For more information about "best practices" around communicating information from a FlexResponse action, and recommended uses of the PreventOrProtectStatus, please see the FlexResponse SDK documentation.
        Parameters:
        preventOrProtectStatus - the updated prevent/protect status for the incident.
        Returns:
        the ActionResultBuilder with the prevent/protect status set.

      • addCustomAttribute

        public ActionResultBuilder addCustomAttribute(CustomAttribute attribute,
                                              java.lang.String newValue)
        Add a custom attribute for this action. When the action returns, the FlexResponse runtime will update the matching custom attribute in the Enforce database with the value provided.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the CustomAttribute to be updated. This attribute is obtained by calling getCustomAttribute() on the incident passed into the IncidentResponseAction.execute() method.
        newValue - the new value for the attribute.
        Returns:
        the ActionResultBuilder with the attribute added.

      • getActionResult

        public ActionResult getActionResult()
        Construct and return an action result based on the values set in this builder.
        Returns:
        a new ActionResult, which you can return from IncidentResponseAction.execute(com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.incident.Incident, com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.configuration.ConfigurationParameters).
